00025 #include "lpc17xx_uart.h"

00029 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00037 #define MCB_LPC_1768
00038 //#define IAR_LPC_1768
00039 
00040 // buffer size definition
00041 #define UART_RING_BUFSIZE 256
00042 /* Auto RTS and Auto CTS definition:
00043  * - 1: Enable Auto RTS and CTS function
00044  * - 0: Disable this function, in this case, handle manually
00045  * modem functionality */
00046 #define AUTO_RTS_CTS_USE        0
00047 
00048 /* Buf mask */
00049 #define __BUF_MASK (UART_RING_BUFSIZE-1)
00050 /* Check buf is full or not */
00051 #define __BUF_IS_FULL(head, tail) ((tail&__BUF_MASK)==((head+1)&__BUF_MASK))
00052 /* Check buf will be full in next receiving or not */
00053 #define __BUF_WILL_FULL(head, tail) ((tail&__BUF_MASK)==((head+2)&__BUF_MASK))
00054 /* Check buf is empty */
00055 #define __BUF_IS_EMPTY(head, tail) ((head&__BUF_MASK)==(tail&__BUF_MASK))
00056 /* Reset buf */
00057 #define __BUF_RESET(bufidx)     (bufidx=0)
00058 #define __BUF_INCR(bufidx)      (bufidx=(bufidx+1)&__BUF_MASK)
00059 
00060 
00061 /************************** PRIVATE TYPES *************************/
00063 typedef struct
00064 {
00065     __IO uint32_t tx_head;                
00066     __IO uint32_t tx_tail;                
00067     __IO uint32_t rx_head;                
00068     __IO uint32_t rx_tail;                
00069     __IO uint8_t  tx[UART_RING_BUFSIZE];  
00070     __IO uint8_t  rx[UART_RING_BUFSIZE];  
00071 } UART_RING_BUFFER_T;

00075 uint8_t menu1[] = "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r";
00076 uint8_t menu2[] =
00077 "UART1 Full Modem \n\r\t "
00078 "MCU LPC17xx - ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r\t "
00079 "UART1 - 9600bps \n\r";
00080 uint8_t menu3[] = "UART demo terminated!\n";

00083 UART_RING_BUFFER_T rb;

00089 __IO FlagStatus TxIntStat;

00104 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00105 /*********************************************************************/
00110 void UART1_IRQHandler(void)
00111 {
00112         uint8_t modemsts;
00113         uint32_t intsrc, tmp, tmp1;
00114 
00115         /* Determine the interrupt source */
00116         intsrc = UART_GetIntId((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1);
00117         tmp = intsrc & UART_IIR_INTID_MASK;
00118 
00119         /*
00120          * In case of using UART1 with full modem,
00121          * interrupt ID = 0 that means modem status interrupt has been detected
00122          */
00123 
00124         if (tmp == 0){
00125                 // Check Modem status
00126                 modemsts = UART_FullModemGetStatus(LPC_UART1);
00127                 #if (AUTO_RTS_CTS_USE == 0)
00128                         // Check CTS status change flag
00129                         if (modemsts & UART1_MODEM_STAT_DELTA_CTS) {
00130                                 // if CTS status is active, continue to send data
00131                                 if (modemsts & UART1_MODEM_STAT_CTS) {
00132                                         // Re-Enable Tx
00133                                         UART_TxCmd((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, ENABLE);
00134                                 }
00135                                 // Otherwise, Stop current transmission immediately
00136                                 else{
00137                                         // Disable Tx
00138                                         UART_TxCmd((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, DISABLE);
00139                                 }
00140                         }
00141                 #endif
00142         }
00143 
00144         // Receive Line Status
00145         if (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_RLS){
00146                 // Check line status
00147                 tmp1 = UART_GetLineStatus((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1);
00148                 // Mask out the Receive Ready and Transmit Holding empty status
00149                 tmp1 &= (UART_LSR_OE | UART_LSR_PE | UART_LSR_FE \
00150                                 | UART_LSR_BI | UART_LSR_RXFE);
00151                 // If any error exist
00152                 if (tmp1) {
00153                         UART1_IntErr(tmp1);
00154                 }
00155         }
00156 
00157         // Receive Data Available or Character time-out
00158         if ((tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_RDA) || (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_CTI)){
00159                 UART1_IntReceive();
00160         }
00161 
00162         // Transmit Holding Empty
00163         if (tmp == UART_IIR_INTID_THRE){
00164                 UART1_IntTransmit();
00165         }
00166 }
00167 
00168 /********************************************************************/
00173 void UART1_IntReceive(void)
00174 {
00175         uint8_t tmpc;
00176         uint32_t rLen;
00177 
00178         while (1){
00179                 // Call UART read function in UART driver
00180                 rLen = UART_Receive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &tmpc, 1, NONE_BLOCKING);
00181                 // If data received
00182                 if (rLen){
00183 
00184                         /* If buffer will be full and RTS is driven manually,
00185                          * RTS pin should be forced into INACTIVE state
00186                          */
00187 #if (AUTO_RTS_CTS_USE == 0)
00188                         if (__BUF_WILL_FULL(rb.rx_head, rb.rx_tail))
00189                         {
00190                                 if (RTS_State == ACTIVE)
00191                                 {
00192                                         // Disable request to send through RTS line
00193                                         UART_FullModemForcePinState(LPC_UART1, UART1_MODEM_PIN_RTS, \
00194                                                         INACTIVE);
00195                                         RTS_State = INACTIVE;
00196                                 }
00197                         }
00198 #endif
00199 
00200                         /* Check if buffer is more space
00201                          * If no more space, remaining character will be trimmed out
00202                          */
00203                         if (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.rx_head,rb.rx_tail)){
00204                                 rb.rx[rb.rx_head] = tmpc;
00205                                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_head);
00206                         }
00207                 }
00208                 // no more data
00209                 else {
00210                         break;
00211                 }
00212         }
00213 }

00215 
00216 /********************************************************************/
00221 void UART1_IntTransmit(void)
00222 {
00223     // Disable THRE interrupt
00224     UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_THRE, DISABLE);
00225 
00226         /* Wait for FIFO buffer empty, transfer UART_TX_FIFO_SIZE bytes
00227          * of data or break whenever ring buffers are empty */
00228         /* Wait until THR empty */
00229     while (UART_CheckBusy((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1) == SET);
00230 
00231         while (!__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.tx_head,rb.tx_tail))
00232     {
00233         /* Move a piece of data into the transmit FIFO */
00234         if (UART_Send((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, (uint8_t *)&rb.tx[rb.tx_tail], \
00235                         1, NONE_BLOCKING)){
00236         /* Update transmit ring FIFO tail pointer */
00237         __BUF_INCR(rb.tx_tail);
00238         } else {
00239                 break;
00240         }
00241     }
00242 
00243     /* If there is no more data to send, disable the transmit
00244        interrupt - else enable it or keep it enabled */
00245         if (__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.tx_head, rb.tx_tail)) {
00246         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_THRE, DISABLE);
00247         // Reset Tx Interrupt state
00248         TxIntStat = RESET;
00249     }
00250     else{
00251         // Set Tx Interrupt state
00252                 TxIntStat = SET;
00253         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_THRE, ENABLE);
00254     }
00255 }

00258 /*********************************************************************/
00263 void UART1_IntErr(uint8_t bLSErrType)
00264 {
00265         uint8_t test;
00266         // Loop forever
00267         while (1){
00268                 // For testing purpose
00269                 test = bLSErrType;
00270         }
00271 }

00273 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00274 /*********************************************************************/
00282 uint32_t UARTSend(LPC_UART_TypeDef *UARTPort, uint8_t *txbuf, uint8_t buflen)
00283 {
00284     uint8_t *data = (uint8_t *) txbuf;
00285     uint32_t bytes = 0;
00286 
00287 
00288         /* Temporarily lock out UART transmit interrupts during this
00289            read so the UART transmit interrupt won't cause problems
00290            with the index values */
00291         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_THRE, DISABLE);
00292 
00293         /* Loop until transmit run buffer is full or until n_bytes
00294            expires */
00295         while ((buflen > 0) && (!__BUF_IS_FULL(rb.tx_head, rb.tx_tail)))
00296         {
00297                 /* Write data from buffer into ring buffer */
00298                 rb.tx[rb.tx_head] = *data;
00299                 data++;
00300 
00301                 /* Increment head pointer */
00302                 __BUF_INCR(rb.tx_head);
00303 
00304                 /* Increment data count and decrement buffer size count */
00305                 bytes++;
00306                 buflen--;
00307         }
00308 
00309         /*
00310          * Check if current Tx interrupt enable is reset,
00311          * that means the Tx interrupt must be re-enabled
00312          * due to call UART_IntTransmit() function to trigger
00313          * this interrupt type
00314          */
00315         if (TxIntStat == RESET) {
00316                 UART1_IntTransmit();
00317         }
00318         /*
00319          * Otherwise, re-enables Tx Interrupt
00320          */
00321         else {
00322                 UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_THRE, ENABLE);
00323         }
00324 
00325     return bytes;
00326 }
00327 
00328 /*********************************************************************/
00336 uint32_t UARTReceive(LPC_UART_TypeDef *UARTPort, uint8_t *rxbuf, uint8_t buflen)
00337 {
00338     uint8_t *data = (uint8_t *) rxbuf;
00339     uint32_t bytes = 0;
00340 
00341         /* Temporarily lock out UART receive interrupts during this
00342            read so the UART receive interrupt won't cause problems
00343            with the index values */
00344         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_RBR, DISABLE);
00345 
00346         /* Loop until receive buffer ring is empty or
00347                 until max_bytes expires */
00348         while ((buflen > 0) && (!(__BUF_IS_EMPTY(rb.rx_head, rb.rx_tail))))
00349         {
00350                 /* Read data from ring buffer into user buffer */
00351                 *data = rb.rx[rb.rx_tail];
00352                 data++;
00353 
00354                 /* Update tail pointer */
00355                 __BUF_INCR(rb.rx_tail);
00356 
00357                 /* Increment data count and decrement buffer size count */
00358                 bytes++;
00359                 buflen--;
00360 
00361 #if (AUTO_RTS_CTS_USE == 0)
00362                 /* In case of driving RTS manually, this pin should be
00363                  * release into ACTIVE state if buffer is free
00364                  */
00365                 if (RTS_State == INACTIVE)
00366                 {
00367                         if (!__BUF_WILL_FULL(rb.rx_head, rb.rx_tail))
00368                         {
00369                                 // Disable request to send through RTS line
00370                                 UART_FullModemForcePinState(LPC_UART1, UART1_MODEM_PIN_RTS, \
00371                                                 ACTIVE);
00372                                 RTS_State = ACTIVE;
00373                         }
00374                 }
00375 #endif
00376         }
00377 
00378         /* Re-enable UART interrupts */
00379         UART_IntConfig(UARTPort, UART_INTCFG_RBR, ENABLE);
00380 
00381     return bytes;
00382 }
00383 
00384 /*********************************************************************/
00389 void print_menu(void)
00390 {
00391         uint32_t tmp, tmp2;
00392         uint8_t *pDat;
00393 
00394         tmp = sizeof(menu1);
00395         tmp2 = 0;
00396         pDat = (uint8_t *)&menu1[0];
00397         while(tmp) {
00398                 tmp2 = UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, pDat, tmp);
00399                 pDat += tmp2;
00400                 tmp -= tmp2;
00401         }
00402 
00403         tmp = sizeof(menu2);
00404         tmp2 = 0;
00405         pDat = (uint8_t *)&menu2[0];
00406         while(tmp) {
00407                 tmp2 = UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, pDat, tmp);
00408                 pDat += tmp2;
00409                 tmp -= tmp2;
00410         }
00411 }

00413 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00414 /*********************************************************************/
00419 int c_entry(void)
00420 {
00421         // UART Configuration structure variable
00422         UART_CFG_Type UARTConfigStruct;
00423         // UART FIFO configuration Struct variable
00424         UART_FIFO_CFG_Type UARTFIFOConfigStruct;
00425         // Pin configuration for UART1
00426         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00427         uint32_t idx, len;
00428         __IO FlagStatus exitflag;
00429         uint8_t buffer[10];
00430 
00431         /*
00432          * Initialize UART1 pin connect
00433          * If using MCB1700 eval board, assign pin P2.0 - P2.7
00434          * If using IAR 1768 KS board, assign pin P0.7 - P0.15
00435          */
00436 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00437         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00438         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00439         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00440         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00441         for (idx = 0; idx <= 7; idx++){
00442                 PinCfg.Pinnum = idx;
00443                 PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00444         }
00445 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00446         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00447         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00448         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00449         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00450         for (idx = 15; idx <= 22; idx++){
00451                 PinCfg.Pinnum = idx;
00452                 PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00453         }
00454 #endif
00455 
00456         /* Initialize UART Configuration parameter structure to default state:
00457          * Baudrate = 9600bps
00458          * 8 data bit
00459          * 1 Stop bit
00460          * None parity
00461          */
00462         UART_ConfigStructInit(&UARTConfigStruct);
00463 
00464         // Initialize UART1 peripheral with given to corresponding parameter
00465         UART_Init((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &UARTConfigStruct);
00466 
00467         /* Initialize FIFOConfigStruct to default state:
00468          *                              - FIFO_DMAMode = DISABLE
00469          *                              - FIFO_Level = UART_FIFO_TRGLEV0
00470          *                              - FIFO_ResetRxBuf = ENABLE
00471          *                              - FIFO_ResetTxBuf = ENABLE
00472          *                              - FIFO_State = ENABLE
00473          */
00474         UART_FIFOConfigStructInit(&UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00475 
00476         // Initialize FIFO for UART1 peripheral
00477         UART_FIFOConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00478 
00479 #if (AUTO_RTS_CTS_USE==0)
00480         /*
00481          * Determine current state of CTS pin to enable Tx
00482          * activity
00483          */
00484         if (UART_FullModemGetStatus(LPC_UART1) & UART1_MODEM_STAT_CTS) {
00485                 // Enable UART Transmit
00486                 UART_TxCmd((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, ENABLE);
00487         }
00488 #else
00489         // Enable UART Transmit
00490         UART_TxCmd((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, ENABLE);
00491 #endif
00492 
00493         // Reset ring buf head and tail idx
00494         __BUF_RESET(rb.rx_head);
00495         __BUF_RESET(rb.rx_tail);
00496         __BUF_RESET(rb.tx_head);
00497         __BUF_RESET(rb.tx_tail);
00498 
00499 #if AUTO_RTS_CTS_USE
00500         UART_FullModemConfigMode(LPC_UART1, UART1_MODEM_MODE_AUTO_RTS, ENABLE);
00501         UART_FullModemConfigMode(LPC_UART1, UART1_MODEM_MODE_AUTO_CTS, ENABLE);
00502 #else
00503         // Enable Modem status interrupt
00504         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART1_INTCFG_MS, ENABLE);
00505         // Enable CTS1 signal transition interrupt
00506         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART1_INTCFG_CTS, ENABLE);
00507         // Force RTS pin state to ACTIVE
00508         UART_FullModemForcePinState(LPC_UART1, UART1_MODEM_PIN_RTS, ACTIVE);
00509         //RESET RTS State flag
00510         RTS_State = ACTIVE;
00511 #endif
00512 
00513 
00514     /* Enable UART Rx interrupt */
00515         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_RBR, ENABLE);
00516         /* Enable UART line status interrupt */
00517         UART_IntConfig((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, UART_INTCFG_RLS, ENABLE);
00518 
00519         /*
00520          * Do not enable transmit interrupt here, since it is handled by
00521          * UART_Send() function, just to reset Tx Interrupt state for the
00522          * first time
00523          */
00524         TxIntStat = RESET;
00525 
00526     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00527     NVIC_SetPriority(UART1_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00528         /* Enable Interrupt for UART1 channel */
00529     NVIC_EnableIRQ(UART1_IRQn);
00530 
00531         // print welcome screen
00532         print_menu();
00533 
00534         // reset exit flag
00535         exitflag = RESET;
00536 
00537     /* Read some data from the buffer */
00538     while (exitflag == RESET)
00539     {
00540        len = 0;
00541         while (len == 0)
00542         {
00543             len = UARTReceive((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
00544         }
00545 
00546         /* Got some data */
00547         idx = 0;
00548         while (idx < len)
00549         {
00550             if (buffer[idx] == 27)
00551             {
00552                 /* ESC key, set exit flag */
00553                 UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, menu3, sizeof(menu3));
00554                 exitflag = SET;
00555             }
00556             else if (buffer[idx] == 'r')
00557             {
00558                 print_menu();
00559             }
00560             else
00561             {
00562                 /* Echo it back */
00563                 UARTSend((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1, &buffer[idx], 1);
00564             }
00565             idx++;
00566         }
00567     }
00568 
00569     // wait for current transmission complete - THR must be empty
00570     while (UART_CheckBusy((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1) == SET);
00571 
00572     // DeInitialize UART1 peripheral
00573     UART_DeInit((LPC_UART_TypeDef *)LPC_UART1);
00574 
00575     /* Loop forever */
00576     while(1);
00577     return 1;
00578 }
00579 
00580 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00581    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00582    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00583    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00584    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00585 int main(void)
00586 {
00587     return c_entry();
00588 }

00593 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00594 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00595 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00596 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00597 * @return               None
00598 *******************************************************************************/
00599 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00600 {
00601         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00602          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00603 
00604         /* Infinite loop */
00605         while(1);
00606 }
